title: Fright Night
review: A real garbage movie with an inexplicably high budget and famous cast. It sets your expectations as low as possible by using a doggy reaction shot in the first minute, and then never exceeds them. It's a contrived sexy teen comedy with a vampire plot stretched very thinly over it. We don't know anything about the vampire's history, personality or motivations. There's more to the monsters in {Scooby Doo}. We work through a checklist of tedious references to vampire tropes, but no time is taken for character development or worldbuilding. The dialogue made me genuinely angry at times, including a pathetic attempt at foreshadowing that spoils the ending, and a moment where David Tennant's absurd Russel Brand/Jack Sparrow character delivers the script's only attempt at emotion: (as a kid) "a vampire killed my parents!" This is nothing more than a comedy horror without any laughs or scares, and plenty of product placement. It was followed by a straight-to-DVD sequel with effectively the same plot.
spoiler: Will we ever see a movie where they do actually defeat vampires with garlic? It might not make for a very exciting ending. Even if it's useful to repel vampires, then it only lowers the stakes.
